item.title: Car has been dumped for the last 2 months in the road. The car now has glat tyre's and damaged wing mirrors., 30th August
item.description:
The parking in the road is very limited and having cars dumped in the street causes the residents to park in other roads. The road is only one of the few streets that has no parking restrictions therefore its abused by station users and staff from the nursery located in Brampton Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Palmeira Road, Welling, London

item.title: Abandoned and untaxed car - causing problems with waste collection, 30th August
item.description:
This car has been parked in front of the fire exit at 43b Chatterton Road for a number of months now. Not only is this a health hazard (blocking the only fire exit for the businesses and people working at 43b), it is also causing a major issue with the bins NOT being collected - the waste is not being collected because this car is parked up against the bins causing the bins to be inaccessible to the ease collectors. We as residents are unable to move the bins out for collection so they are left behind every time. Litter is accumulating because they are not being collected, and we are unable to use the bins because they are so full. Bin bags are then being placed on top of or to the side of the bins on the street; this results in foxes accessing the waste and creating huge amounts of unpleasant mess and litter strewn across the entire area and road. Please see attached photo evidence of this. This is causing very unpleasant smells and is unsightly for those who live here. It would be greatly appreciated if this matter could be resolved by removing the vehicle please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Walpole Road, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet
